intro: Nephrodium funestum, commonly known as the black nephroid, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black, heart-shaped leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Nephrodium funestum is often found in wetland environments and is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
